p: Syphilis is a reportable illness in Taiwan health care system. A syphilis episode refers to a syphilis test in conjunction with ICD-CM-9 codes related to primary, secondary or latent syphilis (091â€“097) treated by currently recommended antibiotics for syphilis, such as benzathine penicillin G, doxycycline, tetracycline, or ceftriaxone. The primary dependent variable is repeat syphilis, which is defined as the second episode of treated syphilis with at least 12 months apart from the first episode. [ 14] Only the episodes of syphilis after the diagnosis of HIV are counted.
